***Pathways is an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to diversity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status or any other protected characteristic.***

title: Financial Analyst, Corporate Financial Planning
description:
**Position****:** Financial Analyst, Corporate Financial Planning

**Departmen**t: Finance & Accounting

**Reports to**: Vice President Corporate Financial Planning & Analysis

**Location**: Portland Remote, U.S. Remote (see location requirements below)

 **Who we are:**


Council on International Education and Exchange (CIEE) is a nonprofit study abroad and intercultural exchange organization that transforms lives and builds bridges between individuals and nations through study abroad and international exchange experiences that help people develop skills for living in a globally interdependent and culturally diverse world.

**Why work with us:**

* **You will change the world**. CIEE builds bridges between different people, different countries, and different cultures. We help young people participate in high-quality international exchange and study abroad programs that bring the world together. We change lives, our alumni change the world. Be part of the change!
* **You will receive a competitive total rewards package (only applicable for U.S. employees).** CIEE provides all employees with exceptional benefits offerings that increase total compensation by up to 25%. Our top-tier benefits include:
	
		
			* Paid time off and Parental leave
			* Gym Reimbursement Program
			* Employee Assistance Program
			* Short-term & Long-term Disability
			* 6 floating Fridays (based on our eligibility rules)
			* CIEE Study Abroad and TEFL Program discounts
			* 403(b) Retirement Plan with employer contribution
			* Insurance Coverage (life, travel, medical, dental and vision)
			* Flexible Spending Accounts/Health Savings Account (medical and dependent)
			* Voluntary Benefits (identity theft protection, pet insurance, accident, and critical illness)
* **You will be part of a fast-paced, international, diverse, and collaborative team of professionals.** CIEE operates the largest nonprofit network of study abroad locations, with facilities and staff in 26 countries. Additionally, we help international participants from over 130 countries come to the USA each year. Committed to excellence and solving whatever problem the world throws at them, CIEE professionals work on international teams, and are dedicated to advancing our 75-year-old mission to make the world a more peaceful place.

 **Who you are:**


The Financial Analyst will have primary responsibility for the coordination and analysis of monthly business unit forecasts and annual budgets. This position will also provide financial and analytical support to facilitate informed and strategic decision-making across the organization.

**What you’ll do**:

* Administration and management of Adaptive Planning system
* Prepare and administer Adaptive training and support
* Coordinate and consolidate monthly reporting package
* Financial partner to Admin units: support managers in monthly forecast prep, financial analysis and variance reporting.
* Assist with data collection to support improved analysis and management of the business
* Inform and influence business partners with regards to how to approach forecast and plan deliverables
* Identify opportunities and drive/support implementation of changes to increase revenues and reduce costs.
* Continuously improve internal processes to drive efficiencies and effectiveness
* Prepare ad hoc financial analyses to influence decision making
* Lead work in a collaborative style, become a sought-out partner, and ensure that financial processes add value

 **What you’ll bring:*** Bachelor’s Degree in Finance or Equivalent discipline required. MBA is a plus
* A minimum of 4 years of experience in Finance role
* Extensive experience with planning and forecasting software. Experience with Netsuite ERP and/or Adaptive Planning budget and forecasting tools a plus.
* Excellent organizational, problem-solving, and analytical skills, along with superior attention to detail
* Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal communications skills
* Self-motivated and self-directed, with a high sense of urgency
* An elevated level of independent judgment and initiative
* Must function at expert level in MS Excel
* Ability to extract data from financial systems and manipulate in offline environments
* Readiness to grow and develop yourself and our Company
* Ability to embrace CIEE’s Core Values (Excellence, Integrity, Respect, Inclusion and Problem Solving) and culture

 **Location Requirements**


The position is available to applicants in Canada and the United States, **except for applicants residing in**:

* Washington (state)
* Colorado
* California
* Jersey City, NJ

**Diversity** **Matters:**


CIEE believes that diversity matters and that professionals with diverse backgrounds provide diverse approaches and ideas to solving problems and finding ways to advance our mission to bring the world together. Candidates from underrepresented groups with diverse backgrounds and experiences are strongly encouraged to apply. *Due to federal regulations, a background and reference check will be conducted as a condition of employment.*

title: Financial Analyst
description:

PO Log  
Data sources and considerations

* Employee discount

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: FP&A Analyst - Mergers & Acquisitions
description:
Description:

Vector Solutions is the leader in providing industry-focused SaaS solutions that connect content and technology. Vector’s unique product set aims at training and learning management, continuing education (CE), compliance, workforce scheduling, safety management, and more.


Our mission is to empower everyday heroes in the public, educational and commercial sectors to make **safer**, **smarter**, and **better** decisions.


Vector Solutions is seeking an FP&A Analyst - Mergers & Acquisitions to play a key role in the financial management and strategic decision-making processes within the Company. This position involves analyzing financial data, preparing reports, identifying trends, and providing valuable insights to support the execution of the organization’s goals. In addition, this role will encompass financial M&A modeling and integration, and special projects designed to foster continuous improvement and drive additional value-creation for the Company.

**What You'll Do:**

* Develop and gain deep business understanding of financial drivers and levers that impact the P&L.
* Generate accurate and timely financial reports (revenue and expense) for management and other stakeholders. Present financial information in a clear and concise manner to facilitate decision-making.
* Maintain monthly / quarterly reporting schedules that track actual vs plan. Conduct variance analysis to understand discrepancies between planned and actual results. Provide actionable recommendations to address any deviations from the financial plan.
* Participate in the post-merger integration plan by providing financial insights and support to ensure a smooth transition. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyze relevant financial and operational information.
* Develop complex financial models to assess the financial viability and impact of potential mergers and acquisitions.
* Build detailed financial models to support project-based initiatives related to product rollouts and process improvements.
* Support recurring external reporting at the lender and investor level.
* Identify opportunities to enhance financial processes and reporting capabilities. Implement improvements to streamline financial analysis and reporting procedures.
* Ensure consistent approach to checking work and uncovering key insights.


Requirements:
* Advanced in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, and PowerPoint) and Microsoft products.
* Manage workload in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
* Strong interpersonal skills, presentation skills, and communication skills (verbal and written).
* Experience in financial analysis and M&A modelling.
* Ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams and under tight deadlines.
* Prior experience working with a planning and reporting tool a plus (preferably Adaptive).
* Demonstrable problem-solving, quantitative, and analytical skills; strategic and critical thinking.
* Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or Economics
* 2 to 4 years' experience in FP&A or M&A positions, preferably with expertise in supporting a growing technology or eLearning SaaS organization.

**What You Can Expect From Us:**

* Friendly, open, and casual work environment
* Comprehensive, quality benefits package effective first of the month following your date of hire
* Tuition Reimbursement Program
* Matching 401(k) retirement plan
* Healthy work-life balance with flexible work arrangements and generous time off
* Generous referral incentive program
* Company social events
* Philanthropic opportunities

**What We Value:**

* Teamwork - **Above all, we’re a team.** We give and value feedback. We support each other, respect each other and work together to accomplish our common goals and serve our customers. Once we make decisions, we align behind them as a team.
* Customers First - **Our customers’ success is our success.** They are why we are here. We work to earn the trust of our customers and always deliver on our commitments.
* Make a Difference - **It’s not a job, it’s a calling.** We have passion for our mission, for our customers, for our work, and for sharing a fulfilling experience with our fellow team members.
* Inclusiveness - **Uniqueness is powerful.** Diversity, equity and inclusion guide how we build our teams and cultivate our leaders, creating a company that promotes a variety of perspectives and crucial conversations, leading to better outcomes.
* Act Now - **We act with urgency.** The best time to get something important done is now. We don’t wait and let perfection be the enemy of good.
* Curiosity - **We love a good challenge.** We’re scrappy, we stretch ourselves to be the best, ask questions, learn from our mistakes, and are dedicated to continually improving and growing.
* Ownership - **We own the outcome and don’t** **pass the buck.** The score matters. We hold ourselves and each other accountable. We treat company resources like they are our own.

*Vector Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer.* *All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, (including gender identity), sexual orientation, gender, race, color, religion, national origin, age, pregnancy, disability, genetic information, marital status, or status as a protected veteran.*

title: Senior Financial Analyst
description:
It's an exciting time to be at Infoblox. Named a Top 25 Cyber Security Company by The Software Report and one of Inc. magazine's Best Workplaces for 2020, Infoblox is the leader in cloud-first networking and security services. Our solutions empower organizations to take full advantage of the cloud to deliver network experiences that are inherently simple, scalable, and reliable for everyone. Infoblox customers are among the largest enterprises in the world and include 70% of the Fortune 500, and our success depends on bright, energetic, talented people who share a passion for building the next generation of networking technologies—and having fun along the way.

We are looking for a Senior Financial Analyst to join our Sales FP&A team, reporting to the director of Americas Sales Finance. In this hybrid or remote work role, you will partner with the Americas Sales team to achieve the company's goals of growth and transformation. You will provide detailed financial analysis and insights to drive strategic decisions in our networking and security business, and your expertise will directly contribute to optimizing sales performance, profitability, and financial planning. This role has a flexible hybrid work schedule. One to two days in the Tacoma office is preferred but negotiable.

You are the ideal candidate if you have experience partnering with a sales organization. You have a strong background in financial analysis, reporting, ad hoc analysis, and interpreting results to recommend financially sound business actions. You are a highly analytical, strategic problem solver, demonstrate excellent business partnership skills, and have a proven track record of accomplishing complex goals and managing multiple initiatives within strict deadlines.
**What you’ll do:*** Conduct detailed financial analysis to support Sales forecasting, budgeting, and strategic planning
* Collaborate with Sales and Finance teams to develop financial models for bookings forecasting and analysis
* Provide analytical support for pricing strategies and Sales incentive plans
* Monitor Sales performance metrics and analyze trends to identify risks and opportunities
* Prepare weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports for senior management, highlighting key business drivers and variances
* Participate in cross-functional projects to optimize operational processes and systems
* Support the implementation of financial best practices across the Americas Sales organization
* Liaise with internal stakeholders to ensure alignment of financial objectives with broader business goals


**What you’ll bring:*** Minimum 8 years of experience with 5 years in FP&A, preferably in the technology sector, ideally networking, security, or SaaS ideal
* Minimum 1 year of experience partnering with a sales organization
* Advanced proficiency in financial modeling and experience with financial systems and tools, such as Excel, Power Query, SAP, Oracle, Adaptive Insights, and Salesforce
* Solid analytical and problem-solving skills with a high level of personal integrity and collaboration
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate financial concepts to non-finance stakeholders
* Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
* Proven track record of driving results and improving financial performance
* Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, economics, or a related field


**What success looks like:**
After six months, you will…

* Develop a thorough understanding of our company's financial processes, sales operations, and key business drivers
* Enhance and manage robust weekly, monthly, and quarterly financial reporting that accurately captures Sales performance and variances
* Actively participate with cross-functional teams to identify and implement improvements in financial processes or systems
* Build strong relationships with key stakeholders in the Sales and Finance teams, demonstrating an ability to understand and support their financial needs


After about a year, you will…

* Play a key role in the annual financial planning process, aligning Sales strategies with financial goals and forecasts
* Provide actionable insights that have directly contributed to optimizing Sales performance and profitability
* Implement at least one major improvement in financial processes or systems, demonstrating innovation and efficiency
* Begin to take on a leadership role within the team, mentoring junior analysts and contributing to their professional development




**We’ve got you covered:**


In the spirit of pay transparency, we are excited to share our compensation philosophy. At Infoblox, we believe in paying for performance. You can expect our employment offers to take many factors into consideration, including but not limited to the location of the role, internal equity, applicable past experience, individual skill set, education, and professional certifications. Please keep in mind that the range mentioned is the base salary range for the role. The typical base salary range for this position in Washington is $97,700 - $130,400, plus corporate bonus potential.

Our holistic **benefits** package includes coverage of your health, wealth, and wellness as well as a great work environment, employee programs, and company culture. We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, including industry best insurance benefits and generous paid time off to help you balance your life. We have a strong culture and live our **values** every day we believe in transparency, curiosity, respect, and above all, having fun while delighting our customers.

Speaking of a great work environment, here are just a few of the perks you may enjoy, depending on your location…* Delicious and healthy snacks and beverages
* Electric vehicle charging stations
* Outdoor amenities (onsite gym, table tennis, pool table, play area, etc.), and courtyard
* Newly remodeled offices with state-of-the-art amenities

**Why Infoblox?**


We’ve created a culture that embraces **diversity, equity, and inclusion** and rewards innovation, curiosity, and creativity. We achieve remarkable results by working together in a supportive environment that focuses on continuous learning and embraces change. So, whether you’re a software engineer, marketing manager, customer care pro, or product specialist, you belong here, where you will have the opportunity to grow and develop your career. Check out **what it’s like to be a Bloxer**. We think you’ll be excited to join our team.

title: Senior Financial Analyst
description:
**About Us:**



SentinelOne is defining the future of cybersecurity through our XDR platform that automatically prevents, detects, and responds to threats in real-time. Singularity XDR ingests data and leverages our patented AI models to deliver autonomous protection. With SentinelOne, organizations gain full transparency into everything happening across the network at machine speed – to defeat every attack, at every stage of the threat lifecycle.



We are a values-driven team where names are known, results are rewarded, and friendships are formed. Trust, accountability, relentlessness, ingenuity, and OneSentinel define the pillars of our collaborative and unified global culture. We're looking for people that will drive team success and collaboration across SentinelOne. If you're enthusiastic about innovative approaches to problem-solving, we would love to speak with you about joining our team!

**What are we looking for?**



SentinelOne is seeking a Senior Financial Analyst to support the GTM and G&A organizations. This role will be highly visible, partnering with organizational leaders to optimize decision-making and reporting on core financial and business metrics. The role will involve business partnering, financial analytics, identifying key trends and insight, and working on strategic projects requiring detailed modeling to drive the decision-making of senior leadership. Additionally, you will collaborate with the Corporate FP&A and Accounting team to execute the monthly and quarterly close and reporting processes and drive process improvements. This role will be reporting directly to the Sr. Director of FP&A. Come join a dynamic team and have an impact on SentinelOne's fast-growing business.


**What will you do?**


* Assist in the core monthly, quarterly, and annual financial planning, budgeting, and reporting processes and perform financial analyses for various revenue and expense streams
* Engage in financial analysis, including special projects, at the request of supported GTM and G&A groups and other key leaders
* Work cross functionally to support departmental leadership in reporting, analytics, and executing financial initiatives
* Be the thought leader on how to drive efficiency in COGS and other important lines of the overall P&L
* Build excellent financial models, especially to assess potential strategic initiatives undertaken by functional leaders
* Partner with the broader organization, including Accounting, IT, and Operations to drive process and systematic improvements across the Company
* Partner closely with the Accounting team for month-end and quarter-end reporting, driving cross-team processes to maintain and improve the predictability of financial results.


**What skills and experience will you bring?**


* BA/BS degree required, preferably in Finance, Economics, Accounting, Mathematics, Engineering, etc.
* 3+ years of Finance experience (Corp FP&A or Business Partnership or Strategic Finance) with forecasting and financial cycle deliverables
* Enterprise SaaS experience
* Excellent written, verbal, quantitative, and presentation skills; innovative, organized
* Advanced Excel, financial modeling, and forecasting skills
* Strong knowledge of GAAP
* Excellent interpersonal skills, highly motivated, and a strong work ethic
* Organized, detail-oriented, and able to balance multiple priorities and non-uniform workloads
* Experience with key business systems (e.g. Adaptive Planning, Netsuite, Coupa) preferred


**Why us?**



You will be joining a cutting-edge company, where you will tackle extraordinary challenges and work with the very best in the industry.


* Medical, Vision, Dental, 401(k) match, Commuter, Health and Dependent FSA
* Unlimited PTO
* Industry leading gender-neutral parental leave
* Paid Company Holidays
* Paid Sick Time
* Employee stock purchase program
* Disability and life insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Gym membership reimbursement
* Cell phone reimbursement
* Numerous company-sponsored events including regular happy hours and team building events


**Why us?**



You will be joining a cutting-edge company, where you will tackle extraordinary challenges and work with the very best in the industry.


* Medical, Vision, Dental, 401(k) match, Commuter, Health and Dependent FSA
* Unlimited PTO
* Industry leading gender-neutral parental leave
* Paid Company Holidays
* Paid Sick Time
* Employee stock purchase program
* Disability and life insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Gym membership reimbursement
* Cell phone reimbursement
* Numerous company-sponsored events including regular happy hours and team building events

This U.S. role has a base pay range that will vary based on the location of the candidate. For some
  

  

locations, a different pay range may apply. If so, this range will be provided to you during the recruiting
  

  

process. You can also reach out to the recruiter with any questions.  

**Base Salary Range**


$104,000—$143,000 USD
SentinelOne is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

title: Senior Financial Analyst
description:
Job Title: Senior Financial Analyst

Reports To: Manager of FP&A

Our client provides a comprehensive scope of construction and professional services to the natural gas and electric industry. Utilities and Pipeline Operators throughout North America choose them for their extensive knowledge, expansive resources, and unmatched scope of services. With legacy companies dating back to 1954, they have built their reputation as an industry leader for solutions and a premier provider of infrastructure services with a solid track record of performance, integrity, and-above all-a commitment to safety and quality.

Position Summary

This position will be responsible for supporting the FP&A Dept with a variety of financial activities including forecasting, budgeting, building financial models, supporting month end close process, as well as ad hoc reporting as needed. A strong background in Excel is required and strong interpersonal skills will be needed as this role will interact with all levels within the organization.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: In coordination with the entire F&A team, this position is responsible for adherence to the Division’s accounting principles, procedures, practices, reporting and compliance requirements of Sarbanes-Oxley and GAAP.

* Assist in month end close process preparing any needed reporting or reconciliations.
* Support FP&A Manager with weekly/monthly operational reporting
* Take lead on developing and monitoring KPI’s across multiple divisions within the company.
* Support the preparation and evaluation of budgets, forecasts, and other financial operating reports.
* Prepare and evaluate analysis based on contract performance and Divisional operating results.
* Prepare various weekly/monthly reporting including (but not limited to) DSO, Weekly OT reporting, and monthly AR reporting.
* Prepare and Review month end journal entries related to FP&A responsibilities.
* Identify trends in financial performance and provide recommendations for improvement.
* Act as back up to FP&A Manager when needed.
* Performing research and analysis as required.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: Requires a bachelor’s degree in accounting or finance with 3-5 years of financial experience and has demonstrated career path of increasing responsibility. Prefer a minimum of 2 years’ experience in the construction industry. An advanced designation is a definite plus. Requires effective oral and written communication skills, excellent interpersonal and customer service skills, and strong computer literacy. A strong proficiency in Excel is required. Must be able to think creatively but be a detail-oriented person. A self-starter with high energy and the ability to organize and prioritize work effectively

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $55.00 - $60.00 per hour

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Work Location: Remote

title: Financial Analyst
description:
Welcome to Frontline Managed Services® – where innovation, technology, and efficiency converge to redefine the landscape of IT, Financial, and Administrative Managed Services for legal and professional service firms. As pioneers in the industry, we are driven by a relentless commitment to excellence.

**Join Our Team and Be a Catalyst for Change!**

**About Us:** At Frontline Managed Services®, we don't just follow industry standards; we set them. Our dynamic environment thrives on pushing boundaries and embracing challenges. We are more than a workplace; we are a community of forward-thinkers dedicated to shaping the future.

**Essential Function/Core Responsibilities:** Are you ready to be at the forefront of financial excellence? As a key player in our team, you will:

* **Analyze Financial Performance**: Dive deep into financial information to assess performance against plans and operational metrics. Your insights will shape recommendations for procedural changes, cost control measures, and other strategic actions.
* **Expertise –** gain an understanding and help manage the financial details for customers, including their billing, contracts, price increases, and profitability.
* **Data Mastery:** Collect, compile, and analyze complex business and financial data, transforming it into integrated revenue/expense projections, and reports that drive informed decision-making.
* **Accuracy and Integrity:** Review data and documents with precision to ensure the accuracy and integrity of our financial and accounting systems, ensuring that our foundation is rock-solid.
* **Recommendation Champion:** Assist in identifying cost-saving and profit-generating opportunities, via automation, process improvement, or system implementations.
* **Trusted Resource** –Engage with key stakeholders across the business providing insightful analysis and financial support for companywide initiatives.

**Job Skills Required:**

* Flexible and comfortable dealing with ambiguity in a fast-paced environment while navigating competing priorities.
* Exhibits objectivity and openness to others' views; Gives and welcomes feedback; Contributes to building a positive team spirit; Puts success of team above own interests.
* Ability to demonstrate initiative and to work independently, excellent leadership, interpersonal, and presentation skills.
* Experience managing team members or an offshore function
* Excellent financial management and planning skills.
* Ability to write reports and business correspondence.
* Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (including advanced proficiency with Excel), and the ability to learn and effectively use software applications such as accounting/billing, HRIS, and other applications used in the performance of job duties.

description:
\\*\\*Also open for internships for university college applicants (*juniors,seniors and postgraduate students only*)\\*\\*

An innovative hedge fund, situated in close proximity to New York City, is currently seeking a dynamic candidate to join the team.

- Conduct financial analysis and research to support investment decision-making

- Perform strategic planning and forecasting to identify potential investment opportunities

Having said that, we value diversity and encourage candidates from various backgrounds to apply. While prior completion of specific programs is certainly advantageous, it is not a strict requirement. We are committed to evaluating each candidate based on their unique strengths and experiences.

title: Senior Financial Analyst
company: BMD, Inc. and Family of Companies
description:
**Senior Financial Analyst**

**Are you a seasoned financial analyst ready to take your career to the next level? Join our dynamic team at BMD - Corporate as a Senior Financial Analyst and play a crucial role in shaping our financial strategies and driving business success.**

As a key member of our finance team, you will provide strategic insights, perform financial analysis, and contribute to the development of business plans. Your analytical expertise will be instrumental in supporting executive decision-making and ensuring the financial health of our organization.

**Why Choose BMD?**

At BMD, we believe in fostering a vibrant and rewarding work environment and company culture where you’ll experience:

* A great company with a solid reputation throughout our 80-year history.
* Employee ownership culture guided by our Pillars of Success and Mission &
* Opportunity to have a positive impact on our processes and the experience of our employee-owners.
* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* 401(k) with a company match, and Employee Stock Ownership Plans (ESOP).
* Total Reward Package also includes incentive plan, medical, dental, vision, paid time off, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, employee assistance program, and more!

If you are a detail-oriented financial professional seeking a challenging and rewarding opportunity, we want to hear from you!

**This role is remote, pay ranges between $90K-100K annual salary.** 

**Overview:** The Senior Financial Analyst in Corporate FP&A is responsible for leading the budget and forecast processes of Building Material Distributors, Inc. This highly visible role reports to the VP Finance and interacts with business and F&A leaders across the company.

Key Responsibilities

* Plan and manage the annual corporate budgeting process, including P&L, B/S, Cash Flow, and CapEx.
* Compile monthly P&L forecast updates to be reviewed with the BMD leadership team.
* Support corporate accounting by analyzing results as part of the monthly close process.
* Assist in the preparation of financial reports for the BMD board of directors.
* Develop and maintain financial-based metrics and KPI’s.
* Partner with F&A and business leaders to analyze cost savings opportunities.
* Prepare financial information for the annual insurance renewal process.
* Support colleagues in Divisional FP&A, Corporate Accounting, and other areas as needed.
* Key FP&A partner to Corporate functions, including HR and IT.

**Skills/Qualifications**

* Superior analytical and critical thinking skills to review data and ensure that finance policies and procedures are followed.
* Strong knowledge of GAAP and Financial Statement Reporting.
* Ability to work autonomously and independently while meeting deadlines through proper time management.
* Strong interpersonal communication skills to enable collaboration with team members in F&A as well as within the business operations.
* Ability to solve difficult and complex accounting and related financial problems.

**Education/Experience**

* 4-8 years progressive experience in finance and accounting, with some experience managing a budget process for a company or a large division.
* Four-year degree in Finance, Accounting, or related field required.
* CPA preferred.

title: Financial Analyst
description:
**Who We Are:**  

  

EmpiRx Health is the leading clinically-driven, customer-first PBM company that puts the pharmacist at the center of its service model to optimize member care while substantially reducing costs for plan sponsors.  

  

**What We Do:**  

  

We place more emphasis on member care than any other PBM by focusing on health outcomes first. Our pharmacists and clinicians are at the center of everything we do―and our population health solution delivers tailored strategies for our clients.  

  

**Who We're Looking For:**  

  

EmpiRx Health is in unprecedented growth, and we're seeking a skilled and experienced Financial Analyst. In this critical role, you will ensure you are analytical, driven by data and have experience of performing analyses on corporate financial performance, development of pricing strategies, profitability assessments, and model development.  

  

If you are a highly motivated Financial Analyst with a demonstrated background in analytics, and you are passionate about making a meaningful impact in the healthcare industry, we encourage you to apply.  

  

**What You'll Do:**  

  

As a Financial Analyst, your role will encompass a wide range of responsibilities:

* Assist in the development of financial models and solutions that will help grow and support internal business goals.
* Collaborate with internal customers to develop client focused analytic models, methodologies, and reports to meet client and advisor needs including reconciliations and rebate statements.
* Interact with multi-functional areas, including finance, underwriting, operations, sales, proposals, marketing, technology, clinical and client management to support internal reporting and financial strategies.
* Prioritize competing requests to ensure focus on highest impact activities.
* Work across corporate finance to assist with report creation and maintenance, ad hoc analyses, and general support.
* Lead efforts to enhance the control environment and implement process improvements through use of automation and standard procedures.

  

**What You Need:*** Bachelor’s Degree, preferably in Finance, Business or Economics
* 2+ yrs. related financial experience or healthcare pricing/PBM pricing
* Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel; proficient in Domo or similar applications
* Excellent attention to details and strong aptitude for analyzing data and problem solving
* Willingness to dive into the data and details.
* Growth mindset equipped with desire for continuous improvement.
* Humble collaborator and must be an excellent team player.
* Strong written and verbal skills, with the ability to present to senior executives


  

**Why Join Us:*** EmpiRx Health is on an extraordinary journey where excellence meets innovation.
* We are a collaborative team that encourages groundbreaking ideas, values open dialogue, and prioritizes continuous improvement.
* You will be part of a dynamic team where success is a shared celebration, collaboration fuels progress, and we redefine healthcare together.
* We offer a generous and competitive benefits package.
* You will share in the company's success through our discretionary bonus program.

**EmpiRx Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer**  

  

At EmpiRx Health, we wholeheartedly embrace the power of diversity and the magic of inclusion. The kaleidoscope of unique perspectives, backgrounds, and talents fuels our innovation and sets us apart. We're not just breaking down barriers but actively erasing them to create an environment where opportunity knows no bounds. In unity, we find our strength and invite individuals from all walks of life to join us in our exhilarating journey to shape a brighter, more inclusive future together.  

  

**Your career at EmpiRx Health awaits – join us in shaping the future of excellence in healthcare.**

title: SVP Financial Planning & Analysis
description:
**FreshRealm - CONNECTING THROUGH MEALS**



At FreshRealm we aspire to be THE fresh meal company. Fresh meals are our focus, and we are passionate about revolutionizing this rapidly growing category.



FreshRealm develops, sources, commercializes and assembles fresh meals. Fresh meals, including meal kits, ready-to-heat and ready-to-cook offerings are 100% our focus. We partner with leading Grocery, Convenience and Omni channel retailers to deliver the very best meals to their customers. Our success is measured by the success of our retail partners. Service, quality and consistency are our obsession, and we take pride in every meal that our customers place on their shelves.



At FreshRealm meals are more than a source of nutrition, they are our passion. Meals are the heart of a timeless ritual of sitting down to connect with family, friends, and ourselves. We are proud to play a small part in the ritual of "connecting us through meals".



If you are a leader looking to build the future of fresh meals, you are growth minded and thrive in an entrepreneurial environment, or you are excited to work with the country's largest retailers, go to market with the best in product quality and work with industry leaders that care for each other and their communities, FreshRealm is the perfect fit for you.


**Overview**



Responsible for the company's day-to-day execution of the company's FP&A operations. They will lead company-wide processes including annual operating plan and long range planning, as well as oversee the monthly reporting and variance analysis, as well as the quarterly re-forecasting process. This individual will work directly with leaders of all functional teams to assist in reporting, forecasting and analyzing financial and operational results, as well as conducting analyses to support better business decisions. Additionally, this position includes responsibility for all daily activities for, and development of, a team.


**Responsibilities**


* Lead the Long Range Planning Process, which occurs quarterly, coordinating with business leaders to develop 3-year business plans, including revenue, expenses, along with fixed and working capital, as well as funding needs.
* Lead the Annual Operating Plan Process, which is a deeper dive than the long range planning process.
* Establish and maintain strong relationships with cross functional leadership teams to identify needs and seek a full range of business solutions; provide executive management with advice on the financial implications of business activities for the organization.
* Manage and improve various reporting cycles, leading the monthly forecasting process, including full P&L ownership and presentation to the Board of Directors.
* Partner with the Integration Management Office to drive the M&A Integration efforts for future acquisitions.
* Work closely with the Controller on cash management and cash flow forecasting.
* Direct the daily activities and the career development of team members.


**Skills and Qualifications**


* Excellent attention to detail around accuracy of numbers reported to internal and external stakeholders.
* Excellent financial modeling experience and skills.
* Exceptional analytical skills.
* Strong strategic thinking and problem-solving skills, including ability to develop strategic frameworks to facilitate decision-making around complex opportunities.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including presentations to senior management.
* Strong project management skills, with ability to lead large cross functional teams in pursuit of common goals.
* M&A, strategic alliance, and/or joint venture execution and integration experience.
* Must be able to work in a fast paced, growth oriented environment.
* Although the position is remotely based, it may require 25% travel or more, depending on business needs.


**Experience / Education**


* BA/BS in Business, preferably in Finance and /or Accounting.
* MBA preferred.
* 10+ years experience in Finance and/or Accounting with at least 5 years in an FP&A role.
* Experience leading teams, ideally in a remote environment.
* Experience in the food industry preferred, but not a deal breaker.
* CFA or CPA a plus.


**Our Values at Work**



We believe that **ACTIONS** speak louder than words and our company values align to those **ACTIONS**.



In our daily work, this looks like:


* **ACCOUNTABILITY:** Set clear objectives and prioritize your tasks Hold yourself and your teams accountable for meeting deadlines Learn from your mistakes and use it as a learning opportunity to improve next time
* **CURIOSITY**: Collaborate with others and explore different perspectives when accomplishing a task or solving a problem Set learning goals for yourself and your team, and have a growth mindset: read books, subscribe to magazines, listen to podcasts, ask for recommendations, etc., on how to grow professionally and personally Don't slap a band-aid on a problem – dig deep and determine the root cause of an issue
* **TRANSPARENCY & HONESTY:** Maintain open and consistent communication. Admit mistakes and take ownership Document decisions to help avoid misunderstandings
* **INNOVATION:** Work with the end-user in mind and create solutions that will add value Question existing norms, assumptions, and best practices Experiment and take calculated, data-driven risks
* **OBJECTIVENESS:** Utilize data and make data-driven decisions at every opportunity
* **NIMBLENESS:** Utilize time management to help stay focused and on task with urgency Continuously evaluate the effectiveness of current strategies and make adjustments accordingly Delegate and trust others to handle specific responsibilities with resources and support
* **SUCCESS THROUGH OUR CUSTOMERS:** Know your audience and the type of work they expect to receive as the end-result of a project, initiative, or task Seek feedback at different stages to ensure you're on the right track Foster collaboration among cross-functional teams to ensure you're providing the best experience and service to our consumers

title: Senior Financial Analyst
description:
**Location: Remote, USA (EST hours preferred)**
-----------------------------------------------



Wealthbox, a maker of CRM software for financial advisors, is looking for a Senior Financial Analyst. As a Senior Financial Analyst at Wealthbox, you will play a pivotal role in driving financial planning, analysis, and decision-making processes. Reporting directly to the VP of Finance, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to provide strategic insights, optimize financial performance, and help drive the Company through its next growth phase.  



**Responsibilities:**
---------------------



Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A):


* Lead the development, consolidation, and analysis of annual budgets, quarterly forecasts, and long-term financial plans.
* Provide accurate and timely financial reports, variance analyses, and performance metrics to senior management.
  


  

Business Partnering:


* Collaborate with department heads and business leaders to understand key drivers, trends, and opportunities impacting financial performance.
* Offer proactive financial guidance to support strategic decision-making and achieve business objectives.
  


  

Financial Modeling:


* Develop and maintain complex financial models to evaluate business scenarios, investment opportunities, and potential risks.
* Conduct sensitivity analysis to assess the impact of various factors on financial outcomes.
  


  

KPI Monitoring:


* Establish and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to evaluate operational and financial performance.
* Work closely with operational teams to identify areas for improvement and efficiency gains.
  


  

Forecasting and Reporting:


* Prepare insightful financial reports and dashboards for executive leadership, highlighting key trends and performance metrics.
* Provide regular updates on financial performance against budget and forecast, offering recommendations for improvement.
  


  

Cost Management:


* Partner with departments to analyze and manage costs effectively, identifying opportunities for cost optimization without compromising performance.
  


  

Financial Systems Automation:


* Work with finance and operations teams to implement automated procedures to enhance efficiency, internal controls, and financial reporting.
  


  

Ad Hoc Analysis:


* Conduct ad hoc financial analysis to support special projects, investment decisions, and other strategic initiatives.

  




**Desired Skills & Experience**
-------------------------------


* Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related field; MBA or advanced finance degree preferred.
* Proven experience as a Financial Analyst, preferably in a SaaS or technology-driven environment.
* Strong proficiency in financial modeling, data analysis, and reporting tools.
* Knowledge of accounting principles and compliance standards.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to convey complex financial concepts to non-finance stakeholders.
* Advanced proficiency in Excel; experience with Stripe and Quickbooks is a plus.
* Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical-thinking skills.
* Proactive with a willingness to dive into details.

  


**Work Schedule**
-----------------


* Weekdays, during business hours.
* No travel is required.

  


**Benefits**
------------


* Competitive compensation
* Comprehensive health plan coverage
* 401k plan
* Paid time off

  




Interested? Email us a note with your resume and a link to your Linkedin profile to jobs@wealthbox.com. Please include “Senior Financial Analyst Application – [Your Name]” in the subject line.

title: Financial Analyst
description:
RAB Lighting is investing in the business and is currently seeking a Financial Analyst, who will join a critical team at the intersection of finance, strategy, and operations. Your analytical and strategic insights will support all areas of the business from departmental budgets through inventory management and corporate strategy.



Primary Responsibilities


* Work across the business to provide financial and decision-making support by means of short- and long-term forecasts and ad hoc modeling requests.
* Assist budgeting and forecasting processes in collaboration with the rest of the finance team using a bottoms-up approach.
* Prepare management and Board of Directors reporting packages and presentations.
* Maintain constant communication with business leaders to provide support and understand the changing needs of the business.
* Manage ad hoc requests for analysis, data modeling and information from business partners across the organization.
* Monitor key metrics including sales performance and inventory.
* Assist in month end closing procedure, audit, and regulatory compliances.

* Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Data Analysis or similar field; MBA a plus


Experience

* Advanced Excel modeling skills are required

* Experience with Business Intelligence tools is a plus
* Experience in financial planning and analysis (FP&A), accounting, consulting, data modeling, corporate strategy, business operations or other finance functions

* Strong communicator with collaborative approach and comfort working cross-functionally

  



Compensation



RAB offers competitive salaries commensurate with experience. Benefits include: insurance (health, dental, vision, disability, life), company match on 401k and Roth IRA plans, parental leave and competitive time off policies. We're serious about finding talented individuals and treating them well.



About RAB



RAB Lighting is committed to creating high-quality, affordable, well-designed and energy-efficient LED lighting and controls that make it easy for distributors to sell, electricians to install and end users to save energy. It's our duty to minimize our environmental impact, create economic opportunity and ensure safe and fair working conditions for all.

title: FP&A Analyst
description:
Join Aterian, Inc. (Nasdaq: ATER) on the cutting edge of technology-driven consumer product innovation!
